p: The average assemblage that increase after the YDB (post-YDB to pre-YDB Ratio >1) include the dominant taxon Poaceae from 31% to 36.7%, Aristotelia chilensis (tree, 8.6%), Saxegothaea conspicua (conifer, 5.4%), Prumnopitys andina (conifer, 2.5%), Weinmannia trichosperma (tree, 4%), Aextoxicon punctatum (tree, 3.6%), Drimys winteri (tree, 0.93%), Eucryphia cordifolia (tree, 0.9%), Asteraceae (herbs, 8.4%), aquatic taxa (16.4%) and ferns (17.5%) (Fig. 13; Supplementary Table S12). This post-YDB assemblage is consistently associated with an abundance of macroscopic and microscopic charcoal that indicates a general increase in wildfire frequency.
